Pre-Game Insights: Both India and Pakistan head into the match undefeated with two comprehensive victories each.
India defeated Australia by six wickets and Afghanistan by eight wickets with 15 overs to spare.
Pakistan defeated the Netherlands by 81 runs and achieved a record World Cup chase against Sri Lanka.
India is third on the World Cup standings with four points and a net run-rate of 1.5, while Pakistan is fourth with four points and a net run-rate of 0.927.
The Narendra Modi Stadium is the biggest cricket ground in the world with a capacity of 130,000.
India captain Rohit Sharma revealed that star opener Shubman Gill is '99 per cent available' for the match after missing the opening two matches due to illness.
Pakistan captain Babar Azam stated that he focuses on the future and aims to break the winless record against India in World Cups.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match will be held at Narendra Modi Stadium, Ahmedabad, with a crowd of more than 100,000 expected.
The conditions at the venue have generally favored fast bowlers, with 59 per cent of the wickets taken by pacers prior to this year's World Cup.
The forecast in Ahmedabad on match day is 'sunny and very warm' with a top of 36C and humidity reaching 57 per cent.
India has never lost to Pakistan in the 50-over World Cup in seven meetings since 1992.
Pakistan's only ODI win at the venue was when it was known as Sardar Patel Stadium, chasing down India's 5-316 in a final ball thriller.
